name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

key_work.title: 16mm news camera with Cosmicar zoom lens used by GTV-9
key_work.brief_description: Model 0. Manufactured by Mitchell Camera Corporation Glendale, California. Complete with added Cosmicar zoom lens 22.5-90mm and wooden tripod. Used by GTV 9.

end.title: I Love Lucy
end.creator_credit: Desi Arnaz, Jack Aldworth and Jess Oppenheimer
end.brief_description: Cuban Bandleader Ricky Ricardo would be happy if his wife Lucy would just be a housewife. Instead she tries to perform at the Tropicana where he works, and make life comically frantic at home.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

constellations_other.name: 1950s television
constellations_other.description: "Good evening ... and welcome to television." Bruce Gyngell’s famous words launched television in Australia in 1956 on Sydney’s TCN9, with the medium finally arriving in the country towards the later end of the decade.

links.description: Most commonly associated with the capture of news and current affairs due to its design, which made it quieter and less invasive on sets and in the field, the Mitchell Newsreel Camera was also seminal for sitcoms such as I Love Lucy (1951–57).

start.title: I Love Lucy

end.title: Mork & Mindy
end.creator_credit: Anthony W. Marshall, Brian Levant, Bruce Johnson, Dale McRaven, Garry Marshall, Henderson Productions, Miller-Milkis Productions and Paramount Television Studios
end.brief_description: Mork & Mindy is an American science fiction sitcom broadcast from 1978 until 1982. The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

links.description: I Love Lucy pioneered the multi-cam sitcom, having three Mitchell Newsreel Cameras set up to cover the action. It made it historically one of the most important shows and a precursor to other genre entries like Mork & Mindy (1978–82)

start.title: Mork & Mindy

end.title: Pretty Woman
end.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, J.F. Lawton, Marilyn Vance, Arnon Milchan, Steven Reuther, Silver Screen Partners IV, Touchstone Pictures and Albert Brenner
end.brief_description: When a millionaire wheeler-dealer enters a business contract with a Hollywood hooker Vivian Ward, he loses his heart in the bargain.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

links.description: In the Happy Days spin-off, star Robin Williams was known to be so active with his performance in Mork & Mindy that a fourth camera was added to the sitcom’s set-up. This idea was credited to Garry Marshall, who directed Pretty Woman (1990).

start.title: Pretty Woman

end.title: The Princess Diaries
end.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Gary Jones, Debra Martin Chase, Mario Iscovich, Whitney Houston, Bottom of the Ninth Productions, BrownHouse Productions, Walt Disney Pictures, Mayne Berke and Gina Wendkos
end.brief_description: A socially awkward but very bright 15-year-old girl being raised by a single mom discovers that she is the princess of a small European country because of the recent death of her long-absent father, who, unknown to her, was the crown prince of Genovia. She must make a choice between continuing the life of a San Francisco teen or stepping up to the throne.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

links.description: Director Garry Marshall is considered one of the most influential rom-com filmmakers, not just because of Pretty Woman (1990) but a legion of other films within the genre that star, are made by and targeted at women like The Princess Diaries (2001).

start.title: The Princess Diaries
start.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Gary Jones, Debra Martin Chase, Mario Iscovich, Whitney Houston, Bottom of the Ninth Productions, BrownHouse Productions, Walt Disney Pictures, Mayne Berke and Gina Wendkos
start.brief_description: A socially awkward but very bright 15-year-old girl being raised by a single mom discovers that she is the princess of a small European country because of the recent death of her long-absent father, who, unknown to her, was the crown prince of Genovia. She must make a choice between continuing the life of a San Francisco teen or stepping up to the throne.

end.title: Cinderella
end.creator_credit: Robert Iscove, Ellen Mirojnick, BrownHouse Productions, Citadel Entertainment, Storyline Entertainment, Walt Disney Pictures and Randy Ser
end.brief_description: This is the third television version of Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Cinderella; a musical written for television, with music by Richard Rodgers and a book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

links.description: Pretty Woman (1990) was the breakout film for Julia Roberts and another Marshall vehicle became the breakout for another future Oscar-winning brunette with a megawatt smile: Anne Hathaway. The Princess Diaries (2001) was produced by Whitney Houston, who had established a solid working relationship with Disney after Cinderella (1997).

start.title: Cinderella
start.creator_credit: Robert Iscove, Ellen Mirojnick, BrownHouse Productions, Citadel Entertainment, Storyline Entertainment, Walt Disney Pictures and Randy Ser
start.brief_description: This is the third television version of Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Cinderella; a musical written for television, with music by Richard Rodgers and a book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II.

end.title: Cinderella
end.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Walt Disney, Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Productions, Bill Peet, Erdman Penner, Harry Reeves, Homer Brightman, Joe Rinaldi, Ken Anderson, Ted Sears and Winston Hibler
end.brief_description: Disney’s beloved animated classic tells the rags-to-riches story of a young woman with an awful step-family.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

links.description: Although rarely credited for it, superstar Whitney Houston – through her company BrownHouse – was an incredibly important producer and helped re-establish Disney’s live action brand with co-producing and co-starring roles in Cinderella (1997). It featured Disney’s first black princess with Brandy playing the title role, based on their animated feature of the same name.

start.title: Cinderella

end.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
end.creator_credit: Barrie M. Osborne, Fran Walsh, Peter Jackson and Tim Sanders
end.headline_credit: New Zealand and United States of America, 2001

video_links.name: The Fellowship of the Ring | The Lord of the Rings 4K Ultra HD | Warner Bros. Entertainment

end.brief_description: Young hobbit Frodo Baggins, after inheriting a mysterious ring from his uncle Bilbo, must leave his home in order to keep it from falling into the hands of its evil creator.

constellations_other.name: Little, big worlds
constellations_other.description: Wes Anderson's stop-motion animation film draws on tried-and-true techniques that, despite the rise of computer-generated imagery, still inspire filmmakers and game-makers.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

constellations_other.name: Perception, time and flickering images
constellations_other.description: Using a peep hole and a loop of rotating still images, mutoscopes control the point of view of the audience while also creating the illusion of depth. Filmmakers have since put optical tricks to work creating surreal scenes.

constellations_other.name: The narrative power of maps
constellations_other.description: Maps are designed to communicate complex information in a clear manner to aid both navigation and wayfinding and knowledge of place.

links.description: Disney was on the verge of bankruptcy when they released Cinderella in (1950), which became their biggest hit since Snow White in the 1930s. Animators used real actors performing on a soundstage as reference to bring the characters to life, a technique not dissimilar to Andy Serkis as Gollum on the set of The Lord Of The Rings (2001–03) trilogy.
